title: Figure, "Uzbek Woman Washing Clothes", 1925–35
markings: underside: hammer, sickle hand-painted in blue overglaze
provenance: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection
creditline: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds
description: Woman dressed in colorful-patterned native costume with turban, resting on one folded leg, the right leg bent with knee raised; she leans over bowl and holds piece of fabric emerging from it; her head turned slightly to her right; small rectangular base.

tombstone.epitaph:
Figure, "Uzbek Woman Washing Clothes", 1925–35.
1925–35. Porcelain, enamel, gilding. The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds. 1989-41-135.
